author: VNExplorer
title: Instead of Selling Their 1960 Classic, They Road-Tripped Through Norway
text:
Patrick Williams, 69, a retired mathematician, and his wife, Anne Williams, 63, who live in Newnan, Ga., on their 1960 Austin-Healey 3000, as told to A.J. Baime.
Patrick: When I was in college, I wanted a car I could fix up. I met a guy who said he could get me an Austin-Healey for free. I met the owner‚Äôs father, who got $100 out of me, in 1974. The car was in horrid shape and not running. I worked on it through college and graduate school in southern California. I ended up buying a second Austin-Healey for parts. By 1977, the car was running. By 1980, I had the bodywork done. Six years later, I married Anne, and on our honeymoon we went to Moss Motors, a parts shop specializing in British sports cars in Goleta, Calif.
Anne: I knew who Patrick was, so to do that on our honeymoon was not a surprise. He can fix anything, and he uses me to reach down into small places where his hands can‚Äôt fit.
Patrick: Around 1999, we moved to Huntsville, Ala., where things were a lot cheaper. I had money, so I took the car to a guy in South Carolina to bring the interior back to the original quality and colors. I love this cream color with red piping; it‚Äôs just so British. Then we moved to the Atlanta area to be closer to our daughter and granddaughter.
Anne: We had to find a house with garage space. Patrick said, ‚ÄúI think I‚Äôm going to sell the car. It‚Äôs just too much trouble.‚Äù I said, ‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt do that! Our granddaughter loves this car!‚Äù The question was, now that he was retired: What were we going to do with it?
Patrick: I resurrected an old email about something called the European Healey Meeting. I said, ‚ÄúHow about this absolutely nutty thing to do? We can put the car in a container and ship it to Norway.‚Äù Anne said, ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs do it!‚Äù I practically fell over on the floor.
Anne: The Euro Healey Meet is held every five years at different locations in Europe. We shipped the car out of Savannah, Ga., in March 2023. We landed in Oslo on June 8. Days later, we arrived in a town called Geiranger, on this Norwegian fiord, where the trip was to start. There we were, with one of about 240 Healeys from all over the world.
Patrick: Austin-Healey is kind of a weird, specialty car. In the early ‚Äô50s, a carmaker named Donald Healey partnered with the British brand Austin. Austin-Healey sports cars were built from 1953 to 1967, and today, they have a big fan base.
Anne: The Euro Healey Meet was a weeklong rally. The drives were insanely beautiful. We had a tiny tool bag, and we felt so much confidence in the car. We never had any problems.
Patrick: We traveled thousands of feet above sea level‚Äîrolling hills with snow everywhere, freezing cold. This was in June! You go through switchbacks as you drive from what feels like winter into spring, and by the time you reach sea level again, it feels like summer. It was breathtaking. We spent three weeks total with the car in Norway and Denmark. The trip reaffirmed how much we love driving this Austin-Healey together.
Anne: Our plan this year is to drive the Natchez Trace, a historic road through three states that goes by Elvis‚Äôs hometown of Tupelo, Miss. Then we‚Äôre driving to Wisconsin, where there is a big Austin-Healey meet planned at the Road America racetrack in September.
Patrick: The new year marks the 50th since I bought the Austin-Healey. I‚Äôm looking forward to 50 more.
Write to A.J. Baime at [email protected] .

author: Andrea Meneses
title: Lee Sun-kyun, el actor de ‚ÄúPar√°sitos‚Äù que fue hallado muerto, implor√≥ a la polic√≠a que no revelara que lo investigaban por drogas
text:
Las √∫ltimas horas de vida de
 Lee Sun-kyun estuvieron marcadas por un intento desesperado de ocultar al ojo p√∫blico sus turbios problemas legales. Seg√∫n reportes de TMZ, apenas cuatro d√≠as antes de que fuera hallado sin vida en su auto, el famoso actor surcoreano suplic√≥ a las autoridades policiales que no revelaran p√∫blicamente la investigaci√≥n que lo involucraba en el consumo de drogas ilegales. [Te puede interesar: Encontraron muerto a Lee Sun-kyun, actor de ‚ÄúPar√°sitos‚Äù](/entretenimiento/2023/12/27/encontraron-muerto-al-actor-de-parasitos-lee-sun-kyun/)
Seg√∫n funcionarios de la polic√≠a, el abogado del protagonista de la exitosa cinta ‚ÄúPar√°sitos‚Äù pidi√≥ que se cerrara la √∫ltima sesi√≥n de preguntas a la prensa este s√°bado, suplicando por privacidad en tanto aliviaba la intensa presi√≥n medi√°tica que lo ten√≠a agobiado. Por ello, el actor deseaba que cualquier interrogatorio futuro se realizara en privado, seg√∫n inform√≥ su letrado. Sin embargo, la solicitud fue rechazada por las autoridades.
Pese a que el jefe de la polic√≠a metropolitana de Incheon, Kim Hui-jung, expres√≥ su pesar por la tr√°gica muerte del actor de 48 a√±os, se reafirm√≥ en que la l√≠nea de interrogatorio se llev√≥ a cabo con el consentimiento de Sun-kyun.
El √∫ltimo contacto de Lee con la justicia fue el 23 de diciembre, mientras se le investigaba por chantaje con drogas. Se le someti√≥ a interrogatorio durante 19 horas y posteriormente fue liberado, pero el peso del esc√°ndalo segu√≠a cerni√©ndose sobre √©l.
[Te puede interesar: D√≥nde ver ‚ÄòPar√°sitos‚Äô, la pel√≠cula protagonizada por Lee Sun-kyun](/mexico/2023/12/27/donde-ver-parasite-parasitos-en-streaming-desde-mexico-la-pelicula-protagonizada-por-lee-sun-kyun/)
Se le acusaba de haber consumido marihuana y otras drogas en la residencia de una azafata de un bar local en varias ocasiones desde principios de a√±o. Seg√∫n la versi√≥n de Lee, la mujer habr√≠a intentado involucrarlo de manera fraudulenta en el consumo de estupefacientes para extorsionarle.
Ante las acusaciones, la defensa de Sun-kyun exigi√≥, un d√≠a antes de su deceso, que se efectuara una prueba de pol√≠grafo tanto al actor como a dos sospechosos detenidos en relaci√≥n con el caso, un hombre y una mujer, para probar la inocencia que √©l sosten√≠a firmemente. No obstante, hasta el momento es incierto si esta prueba se llev√≥ a cabo.
Lee Sun-kyun, de 48 a√±os, fue encontrado inconsciente en el interior de un autom√≥vil aparcado en un parque del centro de Se√∫l a las 10.30 hora local de este mi√©rcoles 27 de diciembre (1.30 GMT), inform√≥ la agencia de noticias Yonhap.
[Te puede interesar: Lee Sun-kyun: las series y pel√≠culas del actor coreano recordado por ‚ÄúPar√°sitos‚Äù](/que-puedo-ver/2023/12/27/lee-sun-kyun-de-parasitos-las-series-y-peliculas-del-fallecido-actor-coreano/)
En el asiento del copiloto se encontr√≥ una briqueta de carb√≥n y la polic√≠a fue informada de que el actor surcoreano habr√≠a dejado en su vivienda una aparente nota de suicidio, por lo que se cree que se quit√≥ la vida.
El nativo de Se√∫l se hab√≠a sometido a tres interrogatorios, el m√°s reciente el pasado fin de semana, en el que hab√≠a dicho a los investigadores que una se√±orita lo hab√≠a enga√±ado para consumir las sustancias, sin √©l saber qu√© tomaba. La mujer fue detenida el mes pasado y se supone que la polic√≠a ha solicitado una orden de arresto para la otra persona involucrada, seg√∫n Yonhap.
Tambi√©n hab√≠a dado negativo en drogas en la prueba de reactivos a la que se someti√≥ durante la investigaci√≥n, as√≠ como en un test de laboratorio realizado por el Servicio Forense Nacional en noviembre.
Lee Sun-kyun naci√≥ el 2 de marzo de 1975 en Se√∫l, Corea del Sur. Con una destacada carrera en su pa√≠s que se extendi√≥ por m√°s de dos d√©cadas, gan√≥ prominencia tanto en la televisi√≥n como en el cine.
Gan√≥ una mayor notoriedad con su participaci√≥n en series de televisi√≥n como ‚ÄúCoffee Prince‚Äù (2007) y ‚ÄúMy Mister‚Äù (2018). En el √°mbito cinematogr√°fico, Sun-kyun particip√≥ en varias pel√≠culas destacadas, incluyendo ‚ÄúA Hard Day‚Äù (2014) y ‚ÄúParasite‚Äù (2019). Esta √∫ltima, dirigida por Bong Joon-ho, recibi√≥ aclamaci√≥n internacional y m√∫ltiples premios, incluyendo el Oscar a la Mejor Pel√≠cula.
√öltimas Noticias
[Es Bodizar Ratkovic, alias ‚ÄúBozo‚Äù, detenido en 2022 por intentar traficar 165 kilos de coca√≠na a Europa. Escap√≥ en el mismo d√≠a que su viejo c√≥mplice fue condenado a once a√±os de prisi√≥n](/sociedad/policiales/2023/12/28/insolito-se-fugo-un-narco-bosnio-que-estaba-bajo-prision-domiciliaria-en-la-casa-de-su-novia-en-avellaneda/)
Ins√≥lito: se fug√≥ un narco bosnio que estaba bajo prisi√≥n domiciliaria en la casa de su novia en Avellaneda
[El intendente de esa ciudad, Federico Susbielles, anunci√≥ que los fondos se utilizar√°n para la refacci√≥n de viviendas y de instituciones escolares, la reforestaci√≥n, la recuperaci√≥n de entidades y la seguridad alimentaria](/politica/2023/12/28/empresas-multinacionales-aportaron-mas-de-9-mil-millones-para-reparar-los-danos-materiales-que-dejo-el-temporal-en-bahia-blanca/)
Empresas multinacionales aportaron m√°s de $9 mil millones para reparar los da√±os materiales que dej√≥ el temporal en Bah√≠a Blanca
[El gobernador inaugur√≥ empresas en Florencio Varela y critic√≥ la mega ley que envi√≥ el presidente al Congreso. ‚ÄúEl ajuste no es a un gobernador, es al pueblo de la provincia de Buenos Aires‚Äù, plante√≥](/politica/2023/12/28/axel-kicillof-los-que-se-dicen-eficientes-ademas-son-bien-vagos-los-decretos-se-los-escriben-otros/)
Axel Kicillof: ‚ÄúLos que se dicen eficientes adem√°s son bien vagos, los decretos se los escriben otros‚Äù
[Previo a ingresar en la casa m√°s famosa del pa√≠s, Juliana tuvo una aparici√≥n en televisi√≥n cuando abri√≥ su coraz√≥n para dar con su media naranja](/teleshow/2023/12/28/antes-de-gran-hermano-furia-busco-el-amor-en-un-programa-para-encontrar-pareja/)
Antes de Gran Hermano: Furia busc√≥ el amor en un programa para encontrar pareja
[El acto se realiz√≥ este jueves por la tarde en el Sal√≥n Dorado del Palacio Legislativo. La distinci√≥n fue un proyecto presentado por la diputada Gimena Villafruela](/politica/2023/12/28/la-legislatura-portena-declaro-personalidad-destacada-a-rafael-grossi-director-de-la-agencia-internacional-de-energia-atomica/)
La Legislatura porte√±a declar√≥ Personalidad Destacada a Rafael Grossi, director de la Agencia Internacional de Energ√≠a At√≥mica

author: Dustin Long
title: Homestead weekend gives Kyle Larson 3 chances at victory and better memories
text:
Homestead weekend gives Kyle Larson 3 chances at victory and better memories
Kyle Larson‚Äôs fondness for Homestead-Miami Speedway is clear but that doesn‚Äôt mean he‚Äôs always left the South Florida track feeling good.
This weekend, he‚Äôll have three chances at victory. Larson will compete in the NASCAR Cup, Xfinity and Craftsman Truck races there in a bid to join Kyle Busch as the only drivers to sweep a triple-header weekend ‚Äî something Busch did at Bristol in 2010 and ‚Äô17.
For a track seemingly built to match Larson‚Äôs talents, Homestead-Miami Speedway has only awarded the Hendrick Motorsports driver one Cup and one Xfinity victory while giving him much more heartache through the years.
‚ÄúI feel like every time I go there, you leave there disappointed because you feel like you‚Äôve had the best car ‚Ä¶ and just things don‚Äôt work out, whether it‚Äôs mistakes on my end or ill-timed cautions, combined with a hiccup on pit road or whatever late in the race, and you end up losing,‚Äù Larson said Wednesday in response to a question from NBC Sports.
Larson has five top-five finishes in 11 Cup starts at the 1.5-mile track. But he admits he remembers the defeats more than victories in his career. Despite his success at Homestead ‚Äî Larson has led a track-record 626 laps in Cup ‚Äî he has more memories of races he didn‚Äôt win there.
‚ÄúI feel like ‚Ä¶ all but two or three races at Homestead, I felt like we had the best car, the best chance of winning and we don‚Äôt have the wins to show for it,‚Äù said Larson, who enters this weekend sixth in the points.
Last year, Larson challenged Ryan Blaney for the lead 13 laps from the finish as they approached Austin Dillon, the last driver on the lead lap. Larson tried to squeeze between Blaney and Dillon and spun. Larson finished 13th.
‚ÄúI don‚Äôt regret anything from that race,‚Äù Larson said. ‚ÄúObviously, if I know the result of what‚Äôs going to happen I would do something different. I would probably just be more patient now.‚Äù
But Larson said he felt like he had to make his move at that point.
‚ÄúThe tires were fading at that point, and I had an opportunity right in front of me and I took it,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIf I‚Äôm more patient right there and I don‚Äôt have another opportunity to win, everybody‚Äôs going to be asking, ‚ÄòIf you had a hole there why didn‚Äôt you try?‚Äô It‚Äôs so easy to look back on things and critique them and all that, but we‚Äôre making split-second decisions out there at 180 miles an hour or whatever we‚Äôre going.
‚ÄúThat race ‚Ä¶ we should have been running 25th with that car, so I was proud of even having an opportunity to race for the win. I know the exterior of the car looked fine, but everything underneath it was junk. I was happy just to have a shot.‚Äù
In 2023, Larson was chasing Blaney, the leader, to pit road when Blaney slowed more than Larson anticipated at pit entrance. Larson moved to the right to avoid hitting Blaney‚Äôs car but struck sand barrels and damaged his car, ending his race.
Larson‚Äôs lone Cup win at Homestead came in 2022 when he led 199 of the 267 laps.
Larson says he loves the track. When NASCAR changed a rule before this season to permit Cup drivers to compete in Dash 4 Cash Xfinity events ‚Äî Saturday‚Äôs race at Homestead is the first Dash 4 Cash 4 race of the season ‚Äî Larson wanted to run that race. He‚Äôll be in a Hendrick Motorsports car for that race and drive for Spire Motorsports in Friday‚Äôs Truck race.
‚ÄúIt was kind of my idea to run triple-duty at Homestead,‚Äù Larson said. ‚Äú ‚Ä¶ Obviously would love to win at least one of them and to win all three would be pretty neat as well.‚Äù

author: Alexa Velez
title: Naples residents warned of potential flooding
text: Naples residents warned of potential flooding As heavy rainfall is expected to hit Naples, city officials are urging residents to take precautions against potential flooding. With more than 7 and a half inches of rain expected in the coming days, the National Weather Service has issued a [ flood watch](https://www.nbc-2.com/article/heavy-rain-and-potentially-severe-storms-are-expected-friday-through-saturday/60269290) effective Thursday until Saturday at 8 p.m. The Director of Public Works for the City of Naples, Bob Middleton, confirmed that crews were working on clearing out drains across the city. Middleton asked the public to help, if possible, by removing debris from inlet structures near their homes to facilitate drainage after the rain. Areas with poor drainage are particularly at risk of flooding, posing a threat to both property and public safety. City officials are advising residents to not drive through flooded areas to avoid potential damage to cars and lower risks associated with floating debris. Bill Runzel, a resident living along a canal near downtown Naples, recounted the devastation he witnessed during Hurricane Ian. "We had the big surge come up the river and probably put 4 to 5 feet of water through here and wiped out anybody that wasn't above flood elevation," he said. While this weekend's rainfall is expected to be a fraction of what was experienced during the hurricane, Runzel and others living near bodies of water are urged to remain vigilant and prepared to take action in the event of flooding.

author: @unilad
title: Chilling 'truth' about the Virgin Mary that 'weeps tears of blood' finally revealed
text:
DNA test results seemingly refute a woman's claims that a statue of the Virgin Mary 'cried blood'.
Back in 2016, Gisella Cardia purchased a statue of the Catholic figure at a
religious site in Medjugorje, Bosnia, and took it home with her to Trevignano Romano, Italy.
Cardia went on to make a serious of claims about the statue, including that it 'cried blood' and conveyed messages to her in an apparent miracle.
Advert
With its supposed supernatural powers in mind, people flocked to visit the effigy, with Cardia going on to receive thousands in donations.
But Cardia faced accusations of fraud by prosecutors in Civitavecchia in 2023 after it was alleged that the blood on the statue was actually
pig's blood.
As part of the investigation, DNA swabs were taken form the Virgin Mary figure and the results have recently been revealed.
Advert
The first set of results confirmed that the blood was that of a human woman, and now further details have emerged.
As per Italian newspaper Corriere della Sera, laboratory tests have found traces of Cardia's DNA in the blood that was on statue.
But her lawyer has argued that doesn't necessarily mean that the whole thing was a sham and that it all comes to down whether the DNA is single-profile or mixed.
With this in mind, she's called for further investigations.
Advert
Solange Marchignoli said: "From a
scientific point of view, the DNA stain deserves further investigation.
"We are waiting to know if it is a mixed or single profile: if the profile is single, it means that it is only Cardia's and she put it there, so in this case we would go to trial, but if, as expected, the profile is mixed, it means that the DNA found on the statue also contains Gisella's DNA, which we expect because she used the statuette, kissed it and handled it."
Marchignoli went on to argue that her client 'is moved by a deep faith and has nothing to gain from this', adding that Cardi is 'not crazy'.
Advert
The DNA results come after the the Diocese of Civita Castellana conducted its own investigation into the matter and ruled that the events in question were 'non-supernatural'.
In a statement issued in May 2024, the religious organization said on behalf of the bishop of Civita Castellana, Marco Salvi: "After an appropriate period of careful discernment, having listened to the testimonies coming from the [diocesan] territory and making use of a commission of experts, made up of a Mariologist, a theologian, a canonist, a psychologist, and with the outside advice of some specialists, having considered the figure of Mary in the Tradition of the Church and in the living faith of the people of God, after fervent prayer, decrees the events in question to be non-supernatural."
Topics:
Religion, News, World News

title: Êñ∞Êó∂‰ª£‰ºÅ‰∏öÂ¶Ç‰ΩïËΩ¨ÂûãÔºü‰∫¨Âçö"Êï∞Êô∫Âåñ"ÂçáÁ∫ßÂ∏¶Êù•Ë°å‰∏öÊñ∞ËåÉÊú¨
text:
ÂΩìÂ∑•‰∏ö4.0Êµ™ÊΩÆÊíû‰∏ä‚ÄúÊñ∞Ë¥®Áîü‰∫ßÂäõ‚ÄùÁöÑÂõΩÂÆ∂ÂëΩÈ¢òÔºåË∞ÅÂ∞ÜÊàê‰∏∫Á†¥Â±ÄËÄÖÔºüÂ¶Ç‰ΩïÂá≠ÂÄüÊï∞Êô∫ÂåñÁöÑ‚ÄúÁüõ‚ÄùÔºåÂà∫Á†¥‰º†ÁªüÁîü‰∫ßÊ®°ÂºèÁöÑÊ°éÊ¢èÊàê‰∏∫Êñ∞ËÄÉÈ¢ò„ÄÇ‰Ωú‰∏∫ÁÇºÂåñ‰∏éÊñ∞ÊùêÊñôÈ¢ÜÂüüÁöÑÊ†áÊùÜ‰ºÅ‰∏öÔºå‰∫¨ÂçöÊ≠£‰ª•Êï∞Êô∫ÂåñËΩ¨Âûã‰∏∫ÂºïÊìéÔºåÈîöÂÆö‚ÄúÂçÅ‰∫î‰∫î‚ÄùÈ´òË¥®ÈáèÂèëÂ±ïÁõÆÊ†áÔºåÈÄöËøáÊ∑±Â∫¶ËûçÂêàAI„ÄÅ5G„ÄÅÂ§ßÊï∞ÊçÆÁ≠âÂâçÊ≤øÊäÄÊúØÔºåÂú®Áîü‰∫ß‰∏ÄÁ∫øÊûÑÂª∫Ëµ∑ËÆæÂ§á‰∫íËÅî„ÄÅÊï∞ÊçÆ‰∫íÈÄö„ÄÅÂú∫ÊôØ‰∫íËûçÁöÑÁ´ã‰ΩìÂåñÊô∫ËÉΩÊñ∞Âú∫ÊôØ„ÄÇ
Êô∫ËÉΩË£ÖÂ§áÈáçÂ°ë‰º†Áªü‰Ωú‰∏öÊñπÂºè

‰æùÊâòËá™‰∏ªÁ†îÂèëÁöÑ‰∫¨Âçö‚ÄúÊô∫ÂøÉ‚ÄùÁîüÊàêÂºè‰∫∫Â∑•Êô∫ËÉΩÂ§ßÊ®°ÂûãÂ∫ïÂ∫ßÂπ≥Âè∞ÔºåÂü∫‰∫éÊô∫ËÉΩÈóÆÁ≠î„ÄÅÊô∫ËÉΩÈóÆÊï∞„ÄÅ‰∏öÂä°ËæÖÂä©Âíå‰ø°ÊÅØÊÉÖÊä•Á≠â‰∏öÂä°Á±ªÂà´ÂÆåÊàê‰∫ÜËøë60È°πÈ°πÂàõÊñ∞Â∫îÁî®Âú∫ÊôØÔºåÂÇ¨Âä®‰ºÅ‰∏öÊïàËÉΩÊèêÂçá‰∏éÁîüÊÄÅÊûÑÂª∫„ÄÇ‰∫¨ÂçöÊéßËÇ°ÈõÜÂõ¢ËΩÆÂÄºÊÄªË£Å„ÄÅ‰∫¨ÂçöÁü≥ÂåñÊÄªÁªèÁêÜÈÇπÈõÑË°®Á§∫Ôºö‚ÄúÊàë‰ª¨Ê∑±ÂàªËÆ§ËØÜÂà∞‰∫∫Â∑•Êô∫ËÉΩÂ§ßÊ®°Âûã‰Ωú‰∏∫Êñ∞‰∏ÄËΩÆÁßëÊäÄÈù©ÂëΩÁöÑÊ†∏ÂøÉÈ©±Âä®ÂäõÔºåÊ≠£ÁßØÊûÅÊã•Êä±Ëøô‰∏ÄÂèòÈù©„ÄÇÂü∫‰∫é‰∫¨Âçö‰∏∞ÂØåÁöÑ‰∫ß‰∏öÂú∫ÊôØÂíåÊµ∑ÈáèÁöÑ‰∏öÂä°Êï∞ÊçÆÔºåÊé®Âä®Ë∑®‰∏öÂä°„ÄÅË∑®Á≥ªÁªüÁöÑÊï∞ÊçÆ‰∫íËÅî‰∫íÈÄöÔºåÂÆûÁé∞‰∫ÜÊï∞Â≠óÂåñÁªèËê•ÊïàÁéá30%ÁöÑÊèêÂçá„ÄÇ‚Äù
‰ªé‚ÄúÂà∂ÈÄ†‚ÄùÂà∞‚ÄúÊô∫ÈÄ†‚ÄùÔºå‰ªé‚Äú‰º†Áªü‚ÄùÂà∞‚ÄúÊú™Êù•‚ÄùÔºå‰∫¨ÂçöÁü≥ÂåñÈÄöËøá‚ÄúÊï∞Êô∫Âåñ‚ÄùËΩ¨ÂûãÂÆûË∑µÔºå‰∏ç‰ªÖÂ§ßÂπÖÊèêÂçá‰∫ÜÂÆâÂÖ®‰∏éÁîü‰∫ßËøêËê•ÊïàÁéáÔºåÊõ¥ÂÇ¨ÁîüÂá∫‰ª•ÁßëÊäÄÂàõÊñ∞‰∏∫Ê†∏ÂøÉ„ÄÅÊï∞Â≠óÂåñÁªèËê•‰∏∫È©±Âä®ÁöÑÊñ∞Ë¥®Áîü‰∫ßÂäõÔºå2025Âπ¥ÊàêÂäüÂÖ•ÈÄâ‚ÄúÂõΩÂÆ∂Á∫ßÊô∫ËÉΩÂà∂ÈÄ†Ê†áÂáÜÂ∫îÁî®ËØïÁÇπÂçï‰Ωç‚ÄùÔºå‰∏∫Ë°å‰∏öËΩ¨ÂûãÂçáÁ∫ßÊèê‰æõ‰∫ÜÂèØÂ§çÂà∂ÁöÑ"Êï∞Êô∫Ê†∑Êùø"„ÄÇ

author: Erica Ponder
title: Organization provides resources for Houston‚Äôs homeless to prepare for hard freeze next week
text:
HOUSTON ‚Äì Since Houston is expected to experience the coldest weather of the season next week, vulnerable populations will need shelter and other resources to get through the event.
According to the National Weather Service , there is an increasing concern for a hard freeze across Southeast Texas that will possibly happen Monday night into Tuesday morning, prompting a Weather Watch from ERCOT .
READ MORE: Major hard freeze headed to Houston KPRC 2‚Ä≤s Re‚ÄôChelle Turner spoke to local non-profits and officials to prepare those in need for the frigid temperatures.
As we help you get prepared for the arctic snap next week, we are highlighting an organization that goes above and beyond to make sure the homeless community is taken care of.
ERCOT monitoring potential cold weather across Texas next week Turner rode along with Harris County Deputy Constable for Precinct 2, Sgt. Ray Perez, and Jonathan Spears, who works as a case manager for Hope Haven.
The pair works together providing food, shelter, resources and a friendly conversation to the homeless community.
‚ÄúWe are going to go out and hand out some food, meet with some of our clients and warn them about the upcoming freeze and encourage them to get some cover,‚Äù Spears said.
Below-freezing temps likely as coldest weather of the season expected next week in SE Texas: What to knowüßä They took Turner to a site on Almeda Genoa Road next to the 99 Cents store.
Trash, chairs, grocery carts, and tarps littered the space. The space looks abandoned but it‚Äôs home to several people.
‚ÄúSome people who don‚Äôt have internet, don‚Äôt have phones, they are unaware of the weather. They don‚Äôt know what is coming. We play a part in coming out here and warning them that the weather is going to be really bad,‚Äù Sgt. Perez said.
Track the Texas power grid: Watch ERCOT‚Äôs current grid conditions in real-time Perez says the goal is to get people to a divergent center or warming center. One couple agreed to go to the divergent center.
‚ÄúWe ‚Äòbout froze the other night, the night before last. It‚Äôs going to be way worse. In Nashville, it gets below freezing,‚Äù the couple said.
After a few conversations, Turner met Will. He‚Äôs been homeless for about a year and plans to leave the site before the cold weather arrives.
HYPOTHERMIA: Here are the warning signs you need to look for ahead of this week‚Äôs freeze ‚ÄúYeah, I will go somewhere. I‚Äôve got some other places that I can stay so I can be out of the wind chill factor,‚Äù he said.
Spears said it‚Äôs a good thing when they can convince someone to get off the streets.
‚ÄúI‚Äôm a recovering addict and alcoholic, so I‚Äôve come from a life of some problems and bad decisions. I‚Äôve had people pour into me to make sure I made the right decision. When I finally did, my life changed,‚Äù Spears said.
Ways to keep your furry friends safe, warm in the winter ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs good to know that somebody is thinking about us and at the end of it, we are all just human beings, and we are cold, hungry. It‚Äôs good to know that somebody is thinking about us from time to time,‚Äù Will said.
Perez and Spears were able to get six people to go to the divergent center, where they will be able to stay up to 14 days and get some much-needed help.
The City of Houston has released a list of warming centers .
RELATED LINKS City of Houston issues winter weather alert ahead of next week‚Äôs hard freeze: See list of warming centers Don‚Äôt forget!
